attributes.action: Delay ULEZ expansion in Greater London during the cost of living crisis
attributes.additional_details: We want the government to recognise that this scheme is undemocratic and will be potentially damaging to tradesmen and low income earners in Greater London. We want government to step in and stop or delay this scheme.
attributes.background: The Mayor of London plans to introduce the ULEZ expansion in Greater London next August 2023. This is going ahead despite public objection, and at the start of a national cost of living crisis.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266
